title: Mate2237
author: Mate2237
content: Hey guys! I made some research and I didn't see this topic and I want to make comments there and since I could not get anyone here so I decided to drop this one. I have been hearing bitcoin bear market and the bull market but I have not really heard of a bear and bull market for Altcoins. So I will like to know the bear and the bull market of the altcoins or are they following the market price of bitcoin? Bitcoin is a project on it own and has it own blockchain and network and likewise with Altcoins.Some of the Altcoins are good to invest but most of us are not aware of that if they are good because there is no bull time for them. And the way I see at them they are just going along with bitcoin. So some of the Altcoins are waiting for the next bitcoin bull market. So my humble question is there no bull market for Altcoins? If yes, there is, then when is the expectation and if no why?

comments.author: oktana
comments.body: The independent Bear and Bull market for altcoins is quite difficult to determine. While it actually exists, Bitcoin normally sets the tone for the overall market. So if Bitcoin is experiencing a bull market, the altcoins suddenly seem to have an increase in demand hence an upward price movement. The same case when it's a bear market; Bitcoin goes down, and altcoins start to nosedive (some even get their new ATL in the process). The last bear market is an example. However, this isn't the same for all altcoins as some altcoins with solid fundamentals, unique features, strong dev teams, etc can have a positive market while others are bleeding.

comments.body: usually based on the cycle it comes after bitcoin bullrun followed by ethereum then altcoin but honestly you can't be so sure.the way altcoin season works is that usually the altcoin increase in unification reaching all time high, even right now if you see the market all altcoins generally that have good fundamental are already raising in term of price.but can you call it altcoin season? i don't think so because these altcoin increase aren't meaningful enough because these altcoin just recovering back from their loss in the previous cycle when we hitting bearish market and losing 80% of all time high value.just wait until bitcoin have massive rally then be prepared for altcoin season, the important thing is you've already accumulated enough.

comments.body: I am not really so good with predicting and speculating anything most especially in regards to the crypto market but what I know is that when there is a bull run for Bitcoin then many altcoins would also be following. If yes, there is, then when is the expectation and if no why?Interesting question! Bitcoin and altcoins are like tide and boats. Bitcoin raises all boats, but sometimes they sail alone. Each altcoin has its own fundamentals and market dynamics. They may seem to follow Bitcoin, but many have their own "seasons"Â of bull markets driven by project milestones or external investment. Altcoin bull markets can be sparked by technology advances, increased popularity, or regulatory developments that favour altcoins over Bitcoin. They are evolving while waiting for Bitcoin to take off. The cryptocurrency market is broad and active, with many projects emerging slowly until they gain popularity. When and how cryptocurrency bull markets occur is more important than whether they occur. Expecting an altcoin bull market depends on market, project development, and investor behaviour. This needs careful research, market cycles, and sometimes timing luck.

comments.author: bluebit25
comments.body: In the crypto market, the trend of altcoins depends on the bitcoin situation, the simplest example is to observe it in the short term (about the last 3 months) when we discuss a lot about the mainstream future of the market. Of course there will still be a lot of buzz around and gaining people's attention, but what we expect more is a clearer signal of bitcoin, before and now the index BTC. D is a way to identify the flow of money from bitcoin to altcoin and vice versa.Most new and old people believe that investing in bitcoin is unlikely to be as profitable as holding altcoins, but that is the story of positions in investment finance, if you take risks easily, you will also easily lose. That's why most of the optimal strategies proposed by experienced people always keep the majority with bitcoin. When the market enters a bullish cycle, the trend of investing heavily in altcoins becomes popular.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: Usually Bitcoin's bull run starts with bull market for Bitcoin and once the value of Bitcoin achieves significant gain there is usually a stagnant phase wherein the price will be in sideways and that's the time Altcoin investment start, on the background people who gains huge profit from Bitcoin starts moving their funds to altcoin once the value of Bitcoin is stable thus inflow of fund along with market sentiment about Bitcoin bullrun plays in favor of Altcoins and this is when the Altcoin bullrun starts with coins achieving ATH but the only difference here when compared to Bitcoin would be that If a coin has performed well in previous bullrun doesn't mean it will do the same this time as well. We have not seen same altcoins breaking their previous ATH and you may check 2017/18 bull run for reference wherein Bitcoin's bull market turn to bear into January 2018 but still ETH sustained till March before entering bear market
